content.question:
A total of <math alttext="13" overflow="scroll"> <mn>13</mn> </math> distinct groups, but with each group similar to the other groups, participated in a craft fair. To investigate how satisfied the participants were with the fair, the fair director conducted a survey. The director randomly selected <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> of the groups participating in the fair and surveyed all members of the selected groups.

Which statement best describes the sampling method used by the director?

choices.label: It was convenience sampling, because participants from each group were easy to contact.
It was simple random sampling, because the participants were selected at random.
It was stratified random sampling, because the director ensured that members from each group were selected.
It was cluster sampling, because the sample consisted of all members of the <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> randomly selected groups.
It was systematic random sampling, because the director selected exactly <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> groups.

content.answer: It was cluster sampling, because the sample consisted of all members of the <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> randomly selected groups.
